item.title: Liberating 14GiB of disk space
item.description: The idea is simple: Remove all duplicates, including zero length files Fine tuning: Hand-pick and remove files deemed unnecessary Since the mileage for second step might vary from person to person, I’ll elaborate on the first step. I chose jdupes as my weapon of choice for finding and removing the duplicates. It’s free and open-source and is cross platform. For a given folder we would run the following to wipe the duplicates:
